property.name: text
property.value:
This model launches a web server and displays a web page with an animated map of Scaife Hall at Carnegie Mellon using Sensor Andrew data: http://localhost:8078/scaife
Please run the model and point your browser to the URL, or run the model and double-click on this comment.

property.name: text
text
property.value: GET /scaife Returns a web page with the Scaife Hall temperature map

property.name: text
property.value: If a GET request is pending in the queue, then send the formatted post as a reply.

property.name: text
property.value: In order to keep the connection alive and responsive, this model will send the defaultResponse if maximumResponseTime (in seconds) has elapsed since the last HTTP Get request. If a post arrives in that time interval, then it will send the contents of the post instead.

property.name: text
property.value: NOTE: The Sensor Andrew password must be stored in $HOME/.ptSensorAndrewPassword.txt

property.name: text
property.value:
Running the model connects to the Sensor Andrew gateway and subscribes to feeds for six sensors in Scaife Hall. The model creates a temperature map web page with a diagram of Scaife Hall showing the temperature in each room. The diagram is updated as Sensor Andrew publishes new temperatures.
The model will throw an exception if it cannot connect to Sensor Andrew. Even if the connection is successful, one or more sensors may be off. If off, typically one temperature is received from each sensor, but no new data will be arrive. In this case, the map will display the first temperature, but display "Off" after a timeout period specified by maximumResponseTime.

property.name: text
property.value: GET /scaife/room# Returns temperature data for the specified room number (for example, http://localhost:8076/room208)

property.name: text
property.value: Initialize timeout for the default response to 1 second, so that the first data points are returned quickly

property.name: text
property.value: After first data point, change the default response timeout to 30 seconds, so page will show "Off" if no new sensor values received

property.name: text
property.value: WebServer.preferredPort blank for dynamic port selection Find deployed port number for header comment link Force evaluation on model start

property.name: text
property.value: This model requires a password to a server, so it is not likely to run for most users.

property.name: text
property.value:
This model queues a get request (at most one) and when a sensor reading arrives, if there is a pending get request, then it responds with the reading.
To avoid a get request timeout, a default value is sent after the maximumResponseTime.

property.name: text
property.value: Restore original defaultResponse after each GET request

property.name: text
property.value: Some readings may arrive before the GET request - store the latest of these as the first defaultResponse

property.name: text
property.value: Each reading that arrives is sent to the output as a response. In addition, if no reading arrives with maximumResponseTime of a trigger input, then send a default response with value defaultResponse (which is by default an empty string).

entity.name: StringConst
entity.doc: Create a constant sequence with a string value.

property.name: text
property.value:
XMPPSource sends packet with all readings from a node (a node may have multiple sensors)
XSLTransformer extracts reading we want: here, {Thermometer Digital = x} Then, extract the numeric value of the reading.

entity.name: FileReader
entity.doc: Read an entire file and output as a string

entity.name: Ramp
entity.doc: Create a sequence of tokens with increasing value
